title: Two talking points about Ronald Reagan that are false
subtitle: Before the GOP candidates get on the stage, they might want to drop these talking points.
author: www.washingtonpost.com
vclaim:
But when we actually examined the historical record, it turned out this was a fairy tale. There was never any such agreement — though Reagan convinced himself there was, based on a misunderstanding.

In the end, Congress actually held up its end of the bargain pretty well — and the failure to make certain cuts was the fault of the Reagan administration itself. (In particularly, Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger simply refused to comply with the agreement.)

Anyone who utters this claim at the table gets an instant Four Pinocchios!

Reagan’s tax cuts produced ‘more revenue’ and ‘tens of millions of jobs’

This fact check examined a specific claim by Sen. Rand Paul (R-Ky.), who asserted that the Reagan tax cuts paid for themselves — and then some.

But we checked the historical record, and Reagan never claimed that would be the case; the Treasury Department confirmed that the Reagan tax cuts reduced revenue.

Moreover, Reagan repeatedly boosted taxes during his term as president, in part to make up for lost revenue from his original tax cut. In other words, the tax cut itself was a money-loser for the government — and it was not the sole reason for “tens of millions” of jobs.

Paul ended up with Three Pinocchios for this making this claim.
